doc.title: Quick Take: CR Gas 1H25: Annus horribilis. Is this the bottom?

passages.text: Asia-Pacific Gas Distributors
**China Resources Gas Group** Ltd
**Neil Beveridge, Ph.D.**
**CR Gas reported 1H25 earnings HKD2.4bn (-30% y-o-y), 27% lower than our**
**expectations.** CR Gas proposed to increase the interim dividend to HKD0.30 per share
(+20% y-o-y). For the full-year guidance, it will pay at least the same amount of dividend as
last year (HKD0.95/share). CR Gas also plans to repurchase 3% of its shares for 2025FY.
Capex was at HKD2.5bn in 1H25 and CR Gas targets HKD4.0-4.5bn recurring capex
(unchanged) and around HKD0.3bn acquisition capex. Free cash flow in 1H25 decreased to HKD0.6bn (vs. HKD1.9bn in 1H24).

**Segment profit from gas sales declined by -14% y-o-y to HKD4.0bn, although the** **sales volume was flat y-o-y.** Industrial gas demand declined by 2% y-o-y to 9.5bcm,followed by residential gas of 6.0bcm (+4% y-o-y) and commercial gas of 4.9bcm (-3% y-o-y). The group targets low single digit growth for gas sales volume in 2025 (vs. 4%-5%previously). Dollar margins improved by RMB0.01/cm to RMB0.55/cm. CR Gas has guided for gross dollar margin to increase by RMB0.01/cm to RMB0.54/cm in 2025 (unchanged).
**Profit from connection fee decreased by -25% y-o-y to HKD0.8bn.** New connected household was 831K in 1H25, which was 19% lower y-o-y (inline with our expectations).
Segment revenue declined by 7% y-o-y. The new residential connection guidance this year has been revised down to 2.1-2.2MM households (vs. 2.3-2.5MM previously).
**Profit from comprehensive services decreased by -19% y-o-y to HKD0.6bn, below** **our expectations of (HKD0.7bn).** The total sales decreased by -18% y-o-y to HKD1.4bn.
CR Gas targets low-to-mid single digit growth for comprehensive services sales (vs.

+20%-30% previously). In 1H25, CR Gas scaled back its comprehensive services due to issues with ChongqingGas's meter reading and staffing, alongside a real estate downturn. To meet full-year targets, it is expanding online and offline channels and focuses on higher-value existing customers.
EXHIBIT 1: CR Gas 1H2025 results vs Bernstein estimates and consensus

Financial SummaryRevenueHKD mnResultsActual vs BernsteinBernsteinActual vs Consensus2025 FY % of 20251H 20251H 2024%YoYNet ProfitHKD mn49,78552,076-4%51,132-3%EPSHKD/sh2,4033,457-30%3,285-27%1.051.52-31%1.45-28%DPSHKD/sh0.300.2520%Payout Ratio%29%16%Segment profitHKD mnGas salesHKD mn4,0204,655-14%4,566-12%Gas connectionsHKD mn8441,124-25%904-7%Sale of gas appliancesHKD mn589761-23%723-19%Gas sales summaryGas sales volumebcm20.820.9-1%20.61%Gas Sales MarginRMB/cm0.550.542%0.550%Connection fee summaryNo. of new residential connectionMil HH0.831.03-19%0.831%
Source: Company presentation, Bloomberg, Bernstein estimates & analysis

- Industrial gas demand declined by \(2\%\) y-o-y to 9.5bcm, followed by residential gas of 6.0bcm (+4% y-o-y) and commercial gas of 4.9bcm (-3% y-o-y). For the industrial gas demand, the demand from ceramics, metal products and nonferrous metal smelting and processing has been highlighted while the demand related to the property market continued to slow down. Total retail gas sales volume in July declined slightly y-o-y. The group targets low single digit growth for gas sales volume in 2025 (vs. 4%-5% previously).

- Dollar margins improved by RMB0.01/cm to RMB0.55/cm. CR Gas has guided for gross dollar margin to increase by RMB0.01/cm to RMB0.54/cm in 2025 (unchanged). Around 80% residential projects achieved implementation of the price pass-through mechanism by 1H25 (vs. previous guidance of 80% to complete by 2025YE). The full-year procurement cost is expected to remain flat or decrease. With a more sufficient gas supply, costs are projected to trend downward.

- New connected household was 831K in 1H25, which was 19% lower y-o-y (inline with our expectations). The old households contributed more to the new connections with the share increasing from 15% in 1H24 to 20% in 1H25. Segment revenue declined by 7% y-o-y.

- The new residential connection guidance this year has been revised down to 2.1-2.2MM households (vs. 2.3-2.5MM previously). 0.96MM new residential customers contracted in 1H25 which should support the full year new connection target.

- The total sales decreased by -18% y-o-y to HKD1.4bn. CR Gas targets low-to-mid single digit growth for comprehensive services sales (vs. +20%-30% previously). In 1H25, CR Gas intentionally scaled back its comprehensive services business due to reported issues with Chongqing Gas, including chaotic meter reading cycles, violations in estimated or incorrect meter readings, and insufficient staffing for meter reading. Additionally, the downturn in the real estate market has indeed impacted the company's operations. To meet the full-year guidance, the company has expanded its channels to leverage both online and offline efforts, while also focusing on increasing the average transaction value by targeting higher-value existing customers.

Integrated Energy business: Segment profit increased by 1% y-o-y to HKD0.16bn, which was mainly driven by the energy sales growth (+9% y-o-y to 2.5bn kWh). Cumulative contracted installed capacity reached 3.3GW, with 2.8GW in operation. CR Gas targets double digit sales growth for IE business in 2025.

Dividend and share buyback: CR Gas proposed to increase the interim dividend to HKD30 cents per share (+20% y- o- y). For the full- year guidance, it will pay at least the same amount of dividend as last year.
CR Gas plans to repurchase \(3\%\) of its shares for 2025FY

Capex during 1H2025 was HKD2.5bn vs. HKD2.4bn in 1H24) and the capex for acquisition was HKD0.1bn.For FY2025, CR Gas maintains the target of HKD4.0- 4.5bn recurring capex (unchanged) and around HKD0.3bn acquisition capex (vs. HKD0.5bn previously).
Free cash flow in 1H25 decreased to HKD0.6bn (vs. HKD1.9bn in 1H24).
Cash and equivalents increased to HKD11.2bn by 1H25, from HKD7.5bn by 2024YE.

Although earnings were a miss, the results were somewhat expected. Natural gas sales profit declined by \(14\%\) despite stable volume and dollar margins. Sales of comprehensive services contracted, primarily due to reported gas meter issues related to Chongqing Gas. On a positive note, CR Gas is placing greater emphasis on the shareholder returns, proposing a \(20\%\) y- o- y increase in the interim dividend to HKD0.30 per share. For the full year, the company intends to maintain at least the same dividend level as last year ( \(>5\%\) dividend yield). Additionally, CR Gas plans to repurchase \(3\%\) of its shares in 2025. We maintain a Market- Perform rating on CR Gas.

References to "Bernstein" or the "Firm" in these disclosures relate to the following entities: Bernstein Institutional Services LLC (April 1, 2024 onwards), Sanford C. Bernstein & Co., LLC (pre April 1, 2024), Bernstein Autonomous LLP, BSG France S.A. (April 1, 2024 onwards), Sanford C. Bernstein (Hong Kong) Limited 盛博香港有限公司, Sanford C. Bernstein (Canada) Limited, Sanford C. Bernstein (India) Private Limited (SEBI registration no. INH00006378), Sanford C. Bernstein (Singapore) Private Limited and Sanford C. Bernstein Japan KK (サンフォード・C・バーンスタイン株式会社).

On April 1, 2024, Société Générale (SG) and AllianceBernstein, LP. (AB) completed a transaction that created a new joint venture in which their respective cash equities and research businesses operate in a new business combination. Although their respective ownership percentages in the joint venture differ between North America and the rest of the world, the creation, production and publication of research is handled collaboratively on a global basis across the two research brands, "Bernstein" and "Autonomous". Unless specifically noted otherwise, for purposes of these disclosures, references to Bernstein's "affiliates" relate to both SG and AB and their respective affiliates.

We value China Resources Gas using the DCF approach using a WACC of \(9.3\%\) and a terminal growth rate of \(1.5\%\) . Our DCF model is based on annual free cash flow forecasts until 2030, plus a terminal value estimate to capture the continuing value of the company. We set a HKD23 target price for CR Gas.
Downside risks include slower than expected gas demand / connection growth, continued margin compression on the uncertainties around downstream regulations to be announced by local government.

The Bernstein brand rates stocks based on forecasts of relative performance for the next 12 months versus the S&P 500 for stocks listed on the U.S. and Canadian exchanges, versus the Bloomberg Europe Developed Markets Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (EDM) for stocks listed on the European exchanges and emerging markets exchanges outside of the Asia Pacific region, versus the Bloomberg Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (US) for stocks listed on the Japanese exchanges, and versus the Bloomberg Asia ex- Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (ASIAX) for stocks listed on the Asian (ex- Japan) exchanges - unless otherwise specified.
The Bernstein brand has three categories of ratings:

- Outperform: Stock will outpace the market index by more than 15 pp- Market-Perform: Stock will perform in line with the market index to within +/-15 pp- Underperform: Stock will trail the performance of the market index by more than 15 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Not Covered (NC) denotes companies that are not under coverage.

The Autonomous brand rates stocks as indicated below. As our benchmarks we use the Bloomberg Europe 500 Banks And Financial Services Index (BEBANKS) and Bloomberg Europe Dev Mkt Financials Large and Mid Cap Price Ret Index EUR (EDMFI) index for developed European banks and Payments, the Bloomberg Europe 500 Insurance Index (BEINSUR) for European insurers, the S&P 500 and S&P Financials for US banks and Payments coverage, S5LIFE for US Insurance, the S&P Insurance Select Industry (SPSIINS) for US Non- Life Insurers coverage, and the Bloomberg Emerging Markets Financials Large, Mid and Small Cap Price Return Index (EMLSF) for emerging market banks and insurers and Payments. Ratings are stated relative to the sector (not the market).
The Autonomous brand has three categories of ratings:

Outperform (OP): Stock will outpace the relevant index by more than 10 pp- Neutral (N): Stock will perform in line with the market index to within \(+ / - 10\) pp- Underperform (UP): Stock will trail the performance of the relevant index by more than 10 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Those denoted as 'Feature' (e.g., Feature Outperform FOP, Feature Under Outperform FUP) are our core ideas. Not Covered (NC) denotes companies that are not under coverage.
For both brands, recommendations are based on a 12- month time horizon.
